  freestar.config = freestar.config || {};

        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">

    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

        <div class="grid-x bg-white grid-padding-x grid-padding-y" style="width: 100%; position: relative;" itemtype="http://schema.org/Product" itemscope><div class="cell small-12" id="toptop"><h1 <div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_1" v-pre>
</div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-6"><likes-rating :perfume_id="95396" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></likes-rating></div><div class="cell small-6"><seasons-rating :perfume_id="95396" chart="show" type-chart="small-chart" colors="retro"></seasons-rating></div><div class="small-12 medium-6 text-center" style="max-height: 50px"><div itemprop="aggregateRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/AggregateRating" itemscope><p class="info-note">Perfume rating&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingValue">3.90</span>&nbsp;out of&nbsp;<span itemprop="bestRating">5</span> with&nbsp;<span itemprop="ratingCount" content="267">267</span> votes<meta itemprop="reviewCount" content="51"/></p></div></div></div><div class="grid-x grid-margin-x grid-margin-y"><div class="cell small-12" itemprop="description" v-pre><p><b>The Dandy</b> by <b>Penhaligon's</b> is a Woody Spicy fragrance for women and men. This is a new fragrance. <b>The Dandy</b> was launched in 2024. The nose behind this fragrance is Fabrice Pellegrin. Top notes are Raspberry, Citron and Bergamot; middle notes are Oak, Whiskey and Cedarwood; base notes are Patchouli and Clearwood. </p><div v-pre class='fragrantica-blockquote'><p>“Penhaligon’s presents The Dandy, a woody ode to whiskey, tinged with impertinence. Surrounded by a cloud of smoke, here we are, the mischievous spirit coming from all sides, following the decadence of rowdy heels. Cast aside all inhibitions, my friends, because once you’re down those steps, the party will never, ever end.<br />
<br />
Run shoulders with visionaries, rub shoulders with artists, loosen that tie, ready for a thousand faces. Lipstick marks on mirrors (and collars), sip amber liqueur.  In crystal glasses, under convoluted chandeliers. Suddenly the stroke of midnight rings out, to the tempo of the brass orchestra, trumpets and saxophones beating time, in the dazzling reflection of your glass. Here we are in the land of jazz, of swing that surges to the rhythm of whiskey, of bebop that gallops to the beats of bourbon. Oh, what tumultuous memories in this den, the spirits cheerful, the cocktails flowing freely. In the misty steam, if the speakeasy stage, in this place the dandy, which will forever be ours…to dance to infinity” </p></div><p class="reviewstrigger" style="font-size: smaller; color: #83a6c4">Read about this perfume in other languages: <a href="https://www.fragrantica.de/Parfum/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Deutsch</a>,  <a </pyramid-level><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Middle Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="middle"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 1; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.326.jpg" style="width: 5rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Oak-326.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Oak</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 1; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.210.jpg" style="width: 4.825rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Whiskey-210.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Whiskey</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 1; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.41.jpg" style="width: 4.15rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Cedar-41.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Cedarwood</div></div></div>
</pyramid-level><h4 style="margin-top: 0.5rem"><b>Base Notes</b></h4><pyramid-level notes="base"><div style="display: flex; justify-content: center; text-align: center; flex-wrap: wrap; align-items: flex-end; flex-direction: row; padding: 0.5rem;"><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 1; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.34.jpg" style="width: 4.35rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Patchouli-34.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Patchouli</div></div><div style="margin: 0.2rem; display: flex; justify-content: center; flex-direction: column; text-align: center; opacity: 0.98070561712475; position: relative;"><div><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/sastojci/t.816.jpg" style="width: 3.85rem;"></div><div><a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/notes/Clearwood-816.html"><span class="link-span"></span></a>Clearwood</div></div></div>
</pyramid-level></pyramid-switch></div></div><div class="cell text-center"><button class="button small" data-open="NotesRatingModal">Vote for Ingredients</button></div></div><notes-rating :perfume_id="95396"></notes-rating></div><div class="cell small-12"><vue-encrypt-postscribe slotid='e9b3a954c0e25a3f3608019d1cc4a8c1546' slotpayload='{"ct":"vTynSESu+4jgfJXIe6LCR7jq4iywvpMZNqgYWOFGQUZv2UpjskmEBt5AKtn31vF8f+K4O\/F9lRoGfRJBzEl6FYtYZX6oLxVDTrRX2tHXBmCL7w4b\/sPfMUNrt0PKlGFy64pg24TAdORpXVJ1JhIARHuULX5Gbx9yBCfgk3mMyNyhQrUmmk8eLNFiILw2YLTq48JkmPinpXP7aZYNzVXk23xSTZXixxfqmyKLozKfxgVIH0bEAtS7H+ISQVIUYFiMah7xweUKjnG9SR6P4HRpGakskhQMWW3HkeslvaqIqmTV5a+G4D0uAnI0LduXgopj","iv":"e9aa46a000a96a2646cc08461d0f54e0","s":"af2c997ba2fb1792"}'></vue-encrypt-postscribe></div><div class="cell small-12"><div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-padding-y"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_3 -->

height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><like style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></like><span class="show-for-medium">Positive Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#popular-negative-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><dislike style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;"></dislike><span class="show-for-medium">Negative Reviews</span></a></li><li class="tabs-title"><a href="#search-reviews"><svg class="menu hide-for-medium" style="width: 1rem; height: 1rem;display: inline-block" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-width="2" d="M7 8h10M7 12h4m1 8l-4-4H5a2 2 0 01-2-2V6a2 2 0 012-2h14a2 2 0 012 2v8a2 2 0 01-2 2h-3l-4 4z"></path></svg><i class="fas fa-search"></i><span class="show-for-medium">Search</span></a></li></ul><reviews-wrapper><div class="tabs-content" data-tabs-content="deeplinked-tabs"><div class="tabs-panel is-active" id="all-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>All Reviews By Date</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
        <div class="cell destinationreview"></div>                    <div id="parent2368464" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2368464" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SaintLaurent"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1105141"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1105141.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SaintLaurent" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Born-to-be-Unforgettable-89141.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.89141.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Born to be Unforgettable"title="Born to be Unforgettable"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2368464ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2368464" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1105141">SaintLaurent</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-12-02"></span><fromunixtime unixtime="1733175272" class="vote-button-legend"></fromunixtime></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Many people don't know / understand this:<br />
An Eau de Parfum contains more perfume-oil, which also means less alcohol, which means you loose silage, but gain longevity. A perfume even more!<br />
Also there are notes and aromy chemicals which favor a scent to be stronger in general, with some notes you wont achieve a strong silage without chemicals.<br />
I know the house of Penhaligon, and their perfume collection (for men and unisex) leans a bit to more natural composed scents (Not tons of Iso-E-Super, or Ambroxan etc...).<br />
The result is a more natural vibe, which may feel a bit less aggressive to the nose. (which is nice)<br />
I own the Tragedy of Lord George, and while some people may say, "its so weak bla bla.." I think its a VERY good performer, you just have to control the strength with number of sprays. Like 5-7, one of the back of your head, 2 on/under your sweatshirt, and so on... this stuff performs superbly. (It holds than, and "breathes" throughout the day)<br />
So I think the Dandy could also be one, where the performance can be achieved with a good amount of sprays and distribution. Like, some People are used to houses that just bomb you away with a blast of performance, achieved by aroma chemicals, and are disappointed when the "big boom" stays missing.<br />
Also Penhaligon's Monsieur Beauregard is a killer Performer, Mr. Sam and Terrible Teddy too.<br />
So this "like most of the penhaligon's" comment is to me a bit unnecessary negative, to me.<br />
Also I think when I read the comments, the name is heavily misleading. I think Penhaligon's refers to the "classic Dandy" which comes from the 18th/19th century: "Dandies in the 18th and 19th centuries in the United States and Great Britain were often men from middle-class backgrounds who were trying to become people from high society."<br />
This is not the "Dandy of the new era in hipster Jeans with iPhones" Scent, it is the "Hat wearing Vintage Dandy with apropriate manners and a laid-back attitude"-Dandy! :D<br />
I don't want to offend anybody of you with my opinion, but I have the gut-feel some of you are just disappointed because you had a different concept what this scent would want to be. I bet if you try to see it as the aristocratic Artwork that was ment to be, you would find a different use in it.<br />
I am going to test "The Dandy" and will update my review here with my thoughts to it very soon! Let's see how good my words stand up then! :D Cheers my dear genlteman!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2368464"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2368464#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2362244" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2362244" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Thatbwoy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1371788"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1371788.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Thatbwoy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Eau-Sauvage-Parfum-2017-43977.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43977.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Sauvage Parfum 2017"title="Eau Sauvage Parfum 2017"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2362244ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2362244" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1371788">Thatbwoy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-26">11/26/24 15:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Good gravy this could be a great scent, I would recommend it to the type of person who wants to give off an air of sophistication.  <br />
<br />
I can just imagine plump raspberries floating in a deep amber pool of rum? Whiskey? Whatever is all held inside an old barrel characteristically battered, beaten and old, but still robust.<br />
<br />
But, all of that imagery, all of those notes. Gone by the time you’ve read this, that impression a fleeing moment in time, almost  fantastically insultingly fleeting <br />
<br />
Like a pixie fart.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2362244"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2362244#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2357006" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2357006" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="neonaya"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/779895"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.779895.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="neonaya" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ralph-Lauren/Woman-by-Ralph-Lauren-45741.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45741.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Woman by Ralph Lauren"title="Woman by Ralph Lauren"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2357006ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2357006" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/779895">neonaya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-21">11/21/24 18:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Stars with interesting accord of raspberry gum and old dry wood. Later sweet base note of common man’s perfume appears. Good that this sweetness is added in tiny doses and do not irritate. Also can detect patchouli, but it only gives the perfume dusty texture. Didn’t notice any freshness from citron or bergamot that are mentioned in the pyramid. Whiskey probably hides behind raspberry and that’s why it’s undetectable. Overall it’s interesting and soft unisex perfume, but why it disappears after just half an hour??? And after 3 hours I can barely smell it from my skin!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2357006"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2357006#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2351838" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <div class="freeStarFragrantica" align="center" data-freestar-ad="__300x300" id="fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6" v-pre>
</div></div><div id="parent2347658" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2347658" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TA2468"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2160015"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2160015.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TA2468" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2347658ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2347658" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2160015">TA2468</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-13">11/13/24 10:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is a boozy and classy wonderland. It truly is magical, the only downside to this fragrance is its high price like other penhaligons fragrances. I would highly suggest getting Babylon or halfetti edp over this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2347658"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2347658#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2346567" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2346567" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MarkBarg"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1868968"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MarkBarg" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Torino21-70424.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70424.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Torino21"title="Torino21"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2346567ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2346567" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1868968">MarkBarg</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-12">11/12/24 11:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love how complex this fragrance is. I was expecting a very woody dark fragrance but it opened with a very light and sweet oaky type of smell. It then changed really quickly and kept the sweetness but I could smell the woodyness more.<br />
Overall love the fragrance, don’t expect anything dark or boozy mostly sweet and woody. <br />
Smell: 8/10<br />
Silage: 6.5/10<br />
Longevity: 7.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2346567"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2346567#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2343918" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2343918" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chrixus86"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2175022"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2175022.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chrixus86" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Jubilation-40-Man-87958.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87958.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jubilation 40 Man"title="Jubilation 40 Man"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2343918ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2343918" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2175022">Chrixus86</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-09">11/09/24 23:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Fresh Cedar is the word. With the citric top and the cedar heart and oak base. This is the perfect spring/Autumn fragrance. Not sure why ppl rate this as a winterish fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2343918"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2343918#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2335847" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2335847" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="OHLAWDTOMFAWD"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1528157"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="OHLAWDTOMFAWD" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2335847ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2335847" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1528157">OHLAWDTOMFAWD</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-11-02">11/02/24 12:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Right away it reminds me of MFK Grand Soir... but the dry down is where it departs.<br />
<br />
It becomes very dry and woody with a hint of the booze element lingering. A Halfeti like spice is lingering somewhere deep in the core.<br />
<br />
Nice for cold weather, but I will stick with the Halfeti lineup from the House.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2335847"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2335847#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2329548" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2329548" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Marie76"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/138192"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.138192.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Marie76" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Estee-Lauder/Tender-Light-69708.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69708.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tender Light"title="Tender Light"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2329548ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2329548" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/138192">Marie76</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-27">10/27/24 16:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume is just way too complex. The opening, heart and dry down are so different from each other I don't think it's possible to "like it"<br />
I get a strong tea note that's not listed, and it's definitely not just bergamot, it's most definitely strong black tea... it reappears in the dry down, which is the softer, most delicate part of it. The middle is strong woods and patchouli, a bit scratchy and masculine for me.<br />
<br />
It's a difficult one to classify, not as beautiful as other Penhaligon fragrances and a bit too much, a bit pretentious.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2329548"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2329548#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2327376" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2327376"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2327376#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2316812" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2316812" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cooling321"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1495871"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1495871.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cooling321" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ard-Al-Zaafaran/Midnight-Oud-66534.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66534.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Midnight Oud"title="Midnight Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2316812ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2316812" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1495871">Cooling321</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-15">10/15/24 14:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Really good scent! Warm uniquely sweet boozy patchouli. I will buy this one and it’s great value too. <br />
Get in.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2316812"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2316812#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2312576" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2312576" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SohrabArt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2283831"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SohrabArt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2312576ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2312576" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2283831">SohrabArt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-11">10/11/24 15:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a very nice scent and good performer.<br />
 It's the dandy boy</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2312576"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2312576#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2311751" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2311751" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JmThms"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293565"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1293565.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JmThms" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Escada/Escada-pour-Homme-1364.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1364.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Escada pour Homme"title="Escada pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2311751ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2311751" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293565">JmThms</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-10">10/10/24 21:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a nice scent profile, with better performance than many people give it credit for. It opens with the soft woods and whiskey,  sweetened by the citrus and raspberry. But the patchouli is quite prominent. When I first sprayed it on test blotter, the patchouli was so strong I thought it might rival my Houbigant Patchouli Sauvage,  which is patchouli on steroids. But on skin, The Dandy's patchouli was tamed, though still prominent. The prominent woodiness is soft, almost like sandalwood. <br />
To honor its name, I might have favored reducing the patchouli a tad, and maybe adding a bit of iris or heliotrope powderiness to augment a somewhat nice sawdust-y woody facet already there. I read that Oscar Wilde was fond of heliotrope, so there's a dandy model right there. So the added powderiness might impart a more dandy vibe. But it's all quite well balanced, rather soft, and pleasant. Although fairly close to the skin, I am getting occasional natural soft wafts of scent to my nose. And that's satisfactory performance in my book. I have another fragrance called Le Dandy Pour Homme by D'Orsey,  released in 1999. It also has a whiskey note, along with rum, pineapple, and plum. More gourmand-y in profile, but I think the two Dandy's might layer very well.<br />
UPDATE 1: I tried the combo wear with Le Dandy by D'Orsey,  and it worked well. Just hold back on the sprays of the D'Orsey. <br />
UPDATE 2: I tried another combo wear for The Dandy with Penhaligon's Much Ado About the Duke, and it was great! The two scent profiles combine beautifully and naturally in the air. Perfect boozy, powdery woods combo. I'll call this my Penhaligon's "Dandy Duke" combo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2311751"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2311751#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2310716" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2310716" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="davidzev"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1143376"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1143376.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="davidzev" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nicolai-Parfumeur-Createur/Cuir-Cuba-Intense-28363.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28363.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cuir Cuba Intense"title="Cuir Cuba Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2310716ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2310716" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1143376">davidzev</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-09">10/09/24 21:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a really nice scent and good performer if you ask me. I think the name is actually fitting, as it’s woody, and slightly sweet with a hint of fruitiness. Refined yet casual, it can make an excellent signature scent imo. <br />
<br />
If I smelled this on someone who seemed stylish and well groomed, I would think yeah it makes sense. Though I wouldn’t really associate dandy with a young man particularly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2310716"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2310716#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2302715" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2302715" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Myst&egrave;res du Ch&acirc;teau de D&eacute;"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1223623"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1223623.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Myst&egrave;res du Ch&acirc;teau de D&eacute;" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rabanne/Paco-Rabanne-Pour-Homme-526.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.526.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Paco Rabanne Pour Homme"title="Paco Rabanne Pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2302715ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2302715" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1223623">Myst&egrave;res du Ch&acirc;teau de D&eacute;</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-02">10/02/24 13:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>No dandy would EVER wear such a wallflower performing cologne, no matter how well crafted and designed and pedigreed.<br />
<br />
Young men in 2024 know the dandy perfumes of today - they are intoxicating, sweet, and highly performing, suiting the peacocks that they are.<br />
<br />
Words have meanings.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2302715"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2302715#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2294502" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2294502" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Steven221283"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360486"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1360486.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Steven221283" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2294502ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2294502" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360486">Steven221283</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-25">09/25/24 06:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't get the negativity with this at all. This should be over a 4.00 rating on here, I know 3.82 (at time of writing) isn't exactly low, but this stuff is great considering the price per ml compared to other Penhaligon's fragrances.<br />
<br />
Opens very boozy, woody and a little earthy. Dries down with the same nuances but the woody earthiness takes the foreground with the booziness poking its head through, but you can definitely still pick it up easily. It's classy and masculine, the name is very fitting!<br />
<br />
On me, the projection and longevity are moderate. By that, I mean it lasts well enough and projects well enough, it's not an in your face fragrance by any means, but it is certain not poor in either of those two fields. It's well put together, very nice quality, and worth picking up for sure. If you do get it, I cross my fingers for you that you don't have the poor longevity and sillage that some people apparently get, if you believe those reviews.<br />
<br />
The comparisons with Straight To Heaven are justified, by the way.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2294502"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2294502#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2291040" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2291040" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="HugoAlfie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1253874"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="HugoAlfie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2291040ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2291040" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1253874">HugoAlfie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-21">09/21/24 22:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is one of those gone-in-60-seconds perfume. The scent itself is not wow-ing me either. Get Bentley Intense or Jazz Club instead!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2291040"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2291040#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2288483" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2288483" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Dingleberries"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173272"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Dingleberries" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-Dusita/Oudh-Infini-36487.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.36487.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oudh Infini"title="Oudh Infini"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2288483ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2288483" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173272">Dingleberries</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-19">09/19/24 14:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>People saying this lasts 30-45 minutes and then another review says it lasted 12 hours on skin...... which fucking one is it? This is why fragrantica is dogshit because someone is lying and I Will believe the majority. Just get a sample and end it there</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2288483"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2288483#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2288273" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2288273" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Turtle2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1962244"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1962244.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Turtle2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Blazing-Mr-Sam-50255.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50255.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Blazing Mr Sam"title="The Blazing Mr Sam"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2288273ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2288273" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1962244">Turtle2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-19">09/19/24 10:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Re-uploading after finally getting the sample.<br />
<br />
The Great Gatsby-esque art deco look of the box and bottle label art fits the 1920s prohibition era jazz club look well, but massive loss of points for the name and whoever chose the name should be demoted at the very least. The Dandy? A dandy feels so out of place for what’s supposed to be a largely whiskey inspired fragrance. To follow the example of Juniper Sling, they should’ve named the parfum after a whiskey based cocktail like a Manhattan or a Zazarac.<br />
<br />
The actual scent itself is skin tight and unless you put your nose up to my forearm or neck you won’t smell anything after an hour. Generally speaking though this seems poor quality from Penhaligons, as the woody notes maintain this similar musty quality that made Marylebone Wood similarly unpopular. On occasion the raspberry notes do punch through early on but quickly  fade away. <br />
<br />
Overall I would give this a 2.90 take this one back to the drawing board, and if you really want a boozy scent with superior quality, get Killian’s Angels Share.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2288273"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2288273#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2287531" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2287531" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AaronTyce"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1363247"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="AaronTyce" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2287531ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2287531" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1363247">AaronTyce</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-18">09/18/24 19:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The Dandy smells amazing but dissipates in 10 seconds. I was in the UK and excited to go to my first Penhaligon’s boutique. I went to try and buy The Dandy. I tested it and got almost nothing from it. I thought that it was because my nose was overwhelmed by the shop. They didn’t have samples so the associate put it on a hanky. Happened upon a second boutique on a day trip. The associate convinced me to buy, but gave me a sample just to be sure. I used the sample for two days. The Dandy has no oomph even when first applying and has zero staying power. I’m really shocked Penhaligons put this on the market. Thankfully I was able to exchange the unopened bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2287531"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2287531#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2286195" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2286195" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eroscestlavie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1916018"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1916018.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eroscestlavie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2286195ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2286195" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1916018">eroscestlavie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-17">09/17/24 14:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought a small bottle mostly just as a memento of a recent UK trip and because the scent is appealing and I love boozy scents. It is a little strange how it performs though–it doesn't vanish, but it is definitely a skin scent after about 45 minutes. Feels kind of like something with these notes &amp; this branding should project a bit; just feels like a mismatch of style and substance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2286195"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2286195#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2281916" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2281916" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Carax"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1815044"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1815044.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Carax" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2281916ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2281916" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); This fragrance brings me closer to the green light.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2281916"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2281916#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2281658" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2281658" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AryanasPerfumes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1209539"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="AryanasPerfumes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/I-Don-t-Need-A-Prince-By-My-Side-To-Be-A-Princess-50497.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50497.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="I Don't Need A Prince By My Side To Be A Princess"title="I Don't Need A Prince By My Side To Be A Princess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2281658ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2281658" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1209539">AryanasPerfumes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-13">09/13/24 12:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I recently tried The Dandy by Penhaligon's  and it instantly reminded me of Straight to Heaven by Kilian, but with a twist. The Dandy is more playful, with a vibrant fruity freshness from raspberry and citron that balances beautifully with the boozy whisky note.<br />
<br />
While Straight to Heaven is darker, with heavy dried fruits and woody cognac barrels, The Dandy feels lighter, more approachable, with an acrid citrus tone that lingers through the base. The whisky remains elegant and smooth, without overpowering the composition, and the dry-down blends woods and ambrox with a subtle smokiness.<br />
<br />
If you like Straight to Heaven but want something fresher and easier to wear, The Dandy might be your perfect match.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2281658"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2281658#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2279496" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2279496" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jroyogi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1196737"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="jroyogi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Azure-Lime-8706.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.8706.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Azure Lime"title="Azure Lime"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2279496ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2279496" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2279486" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scent.guide"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1406103"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1406103.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scent.guide" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2279486ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2279486" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); Love it :) All this notes are quite balanced and rounded with a touch of powdery notes and soft (slightly oily) woods. For me it aaaaalmost smells a bit feminine because raspberries here reminds me of some lipstick scent. But it definitely can be very sexy (for all genders)).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="95396"comment_id="2279486"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Penhaligon-s/The-Dandy-95396.html?ccid=2279486#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2279457" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
